alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - An additional thunderstorm is approaching the Flood Advisory area from the southwest. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding of small creeks and streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vanceboro, Codyville Plantation, Lambert Lake and Forest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
